Package cs0x65.parkinglot.command

The package provides all the infrastructure required to read, parse and execute the commands in fashion similar to the bash shell.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Parser<T>
    Interface for parsing the command text.

    This class represents the domain specific abstraction of the supplied text commands.

    BadCommandException

    The class captures the exception encountered during binding of the Command's output template with the supplied accessors.

Package cs0x65.parkinglot.command Description

The package provides all the infrastructure required to read, parse and execute the commands in fashion similar to the bash shell. The main classes that support this abstraction are:

Processor: In essence, commands - which are directives given in the form of string/text are typically read from either the standard input i.e. STDIN or from the file (similar to how bash script file is written). This task is performed by Processor. It reads commands from the specified source one by one and passes over to the parser for further processing.

Parser: Parser parses the command text and performs the following tasks:
  • Syntactic validations: to make sure the command supplied is amongst the set of supported commands and & adheres to the grammar/syntax of the command.
  • Building domain specific Command<T> instances that are backed by the domain implementation class and where T is the actual target to carry out the supplied command. Effectively, Parser also forms the bridge between the textual commands supplied and the supporting domain classes by building instances of the Command<T>. It is responsibility of the parser implementation to make sure all the necessary information and metadata is supplied to the Command<T> instances for their correct execution. Refer DefaultParserImpl which is the domain specific implementation of the Parser pertaining to ParkingLot.


Command This class builds the domain specific abstraction of the supplied text commands. The class works in co-ordination of the domain specific implementation of Parser like DefaultParserImpl for parking lot domain. A typical Command<T> captures all the information required to execute the command on the provided target class indicated by the instance of parameterized type. The information includes:
  • The target T which is the target class implementing the domain specific commands, for e.g ParkingLot
  • The result object which is the domain specific result of executing the command on the target T
  • The verbMethod Method that will be invoked on the target T to obtain the result
  • Because commands essentially produce formatted output that's rendered on STOUT or STDERR or to file streams/readers, the class also captures the output template and a mechanism to bind values to the template placeholders. Such a processed template is returned for rendering by the corresponding Processor. Additionally, the class provides executeAndPrint() variants that also flushes the output to the provided print stream or writer.


DefaultParserImpl which is the domain specific implementation of the Parser pertaining to ParkingLot. It does an extensive work of parsing, syntactical analysis, emitting the usage help text in case of wrong command usage etc. apart from the core responsibility of binding textual commands read from the source to the parking lot specific commands: Command<ParkingLot> The supported commands are
  • create_parking_lot {size}
  • park {registraionNo}
  • leave {registraionNo [duration]}
  • status {[includeEmptySlots]]}
